qas.question: Whose masterpieces are a mixture of naturallism with stylization?
In whose depictions can the evolution of Greek sculpture be observed?
Who seems to be released from any art and religious conformities?

context: The evolution of the Greek sculpture can be observed in his depictions from the almost static formal Kouros type in early archaic period, to the representation of motion in a relative harmonious whole in late archaic period. In classical Greece the emphasis is not given to the illusive imaginative reality represented by the ideal forms, but to the analogies and the interaction of the members in the whole, a method created by Polykleitos. Finally <a0_0><a1_0><a2_0>Praxiteles<a2_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/> seems to be released from any art and religious conformities, and his masterpieces are a mixture of naturalism with stylization.
